summary: A substantial working paper comparing school systems with education systems and arguing PEI operates the former, not the latter. Don establishes that education's future impact depends on citizen education quality, that education is an umbrella concept encompassing all impact-bearing experiences, and that early home/family experiences plus teacher influence are key. Don identifies accountability types (compliance, professional norms, results), observes PEI lacks clear role descriptions for teachers/principals and performance reports, and recommends readings (OECD Education 2030, PISA, World Bank Education Crisis 2019, CMEC PCAP 2019). This paper represents Don's most comprehensive systematic analysis.
